meanings.definition: A compound released by cells in response to injury or allergic and inflammatory reactions, causing contraction of smooth muscle and dilation of capillaries.
meanings.sent1: Histamin helps our body respond to injuries and allergies by making muscles contract and blood vessels widen.
meanings.sent2: Doctors study histamin to understand how our bodies react to injuries and allergies.
meanings.sent3: When histamin gets too excited, it starts making muscles dance and blood vessels stretch like rubber bands!
meanings.sent4: The histamin in our body is like a traffic controller, directing muscles to tighten and blood vessels to expand.
meanings.sent5: Imagine histamin as a tiny messenger that tells our body to tighten up and open wide in times of need.
